intro: Navarretia virgata var. floribunda, commonly known as the showy navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers during the spring, which are borne on slender, branching stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Navarretia virgata var. floribunda is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
